definitions.definition: a play, film or TV show that is intended to be funny, usually with a happy ending; plays, films and TV shows of this type

examples.text: a **black comedy** (= a play or film that deals with unpleasant or terrible things in a humorous way)
He moved to Los Angeles to write comedy.
a comedy about an eccentric family
She went on to star in a hit **comedy series**.
His TV **comedy shows** ran during the 70s and 80s.
They spent hours watching comedy on television.

definitions.definition: professional entertainment with jokes, short acts, etc. that is intended to be funny

examples.text: The show combines theatre with the best of stand-up and sketch comedy.
Her imaginative interpretation of the script brought out the comedy inherent in it.
He didn't appreciate the comedy of the situation.
The visual comedy of this scene is obvious.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (as a genre of drama, also denoting a narrative poem with a happy ending, as in Dante's Divine Comedy): from Old French comedie, via Latin from Greek kōmōidia, from kōmōidos ‘comic poet’, from kōmos ‘revel’ + aoidos ‘singer’.
